title: Propulsion Assignment
description: The objective of this assignment is to develop an understanding of propulsion systems, including their principles, design, and application in various engineering contexts. You will explore different types of propulsion systems, analyze their performance, and apply theoretical concepts to practical scenarios.

title: Combustion Analysis
description: The purpose of this assignment is to analyze the combustion process of a given hydrocarbon fuel. You will determine the combustion products, calculate the air-fuel ratio, and evaluate the efficiency of the combustion process. This analysis is crucial in understanding the chemical reactions involved, optimizing fuel usage, and minimizing environmental impact.

title: Nozzle Design Project
description: The goal of this assignment is to design and analyze a nozzle for a given application, such as a rocket engine, gas turbine, or fluid flow system. You will determine the optimal nozzle shape, calculate the flow characteristics, and evaluate the performance of the nozzle under various operating conditions. This project will enhance your understanding of fluid dynamics and thermodynamics in the context of nozzle design.

title: Aerodynamics Quiz
description: The objective of this quiz is to assess your understanding of fundamental concepts in aerodynamics, including airflow, lift, drag, and the principles governing the behavior of air around objects. This quiz will test your theoretical knowledge and problem-solving abilities related to aerodynamics.

title: Flow Analysis
description: The purpose of this assignment is to analyze fluid flow through a given system or component. You will study the behavior of fluid under various conditions, calculate key flow parameters, and use computational and analytical methods to evaluate the system's performance. This analysis is crucial in applications such as pipeline design, HVAC systems, and aerodynamics.

title: Structural Design Task
description: The objective of this assignment is to design and analyze a structural component or system. You will apply principles of structural engineering to ensure that the design meets specified performance criteria under given loads and conditions. This task will help you understand the fundamentals of structural analysis, material selection, and safety considerations in engineering design.
